alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...CENTRAL COSHOCTON...NORTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTHWESTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coshocton to 9 miles south of West Lafayette to New Concord. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coshocton, Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, West Lafayette, Conesville, Plainfield, Norwich, Otsego, Chili, Boden, and Kimbolton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 166 and 171, and between mile markers 174 and 177. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 46 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
